title: In this regard, Potts (1993: 197) has identified a Sasanian lead horse uncovered in north-east Arabia as a gift that was probably given to Sasanian clients in the region. There is no reason this could not have been given to the Nasrids
Indeed, the same is true in Armenia, where the Sasanians were eager to abolish the Arsacid monarchy in order to focus on building relationships with individual Armenian nakharars
